response:
Neuroimaging is essential to demonstrate dissemination in space and time. Lumbar puncture and serology are required to differentiate between MS, NMO/MOG, and mimics like infection or sarcoidosis. Visual testing quantifies the optic nerve damage.

investigations = ["MRI Brain and Whole Spine with Gadolinium", "Visual Evoked Potentials", "Optical Coherence Tomography", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Serum AQP4 antibodies", "Serum MOG antibodies", "Autoimmune screen (ANA, ENA, dsDNA)", "Vitamin B12 and Folate", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology", "Lumbar Puncture for CSF analysis (Oligoclonal bands, protein, glucose, cell count, culture, viral PCR)"]
